title: Re-working of how parameters are passed to BO for reports
custom_preconds:
(note to QA: this will need to be tested on reports globally, devs should provide a list of reports to check on the attached story)
GIVEN devs have re-worked how parameters are passed to BO for reports that open in a new tab from EBIS (Bulk NOD for example)
custom_steps: WHEN user runs a report that opens a new BO tab
custom_expected: THEN that report should run as expected for any prompts selected

title: As a developer i want to be able to get MJC ids that were updated (via a data fix)
custom_preconds: GIVEN one or more fields on an MJC have been data fixed by devs
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the Ebis Link Updated Batch
custom_expected: THEN MJC IDs for all the MJC that were data fixed should display in batch results

title: As a BOC user I want to edit an existing form in the System Forms widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user logs in with system forms widget edit permission
AND user sees a pencil icon on each row in the widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the pencil icon
custom_expected:
THEN system will place that row in edit mode.
AND Once any row is in edit mode, the "Save" button appears and is enabled.
AND Once any row is in edit mode, the "Cancel All Changes" button appears and is enabled. 
AND When a row is in edit mode, there is a red x on the row that allows the user to cancel the editing of that row. If this x is clicked, any changes made are discarded. If this was the only row in edit mode, then the Save and Cancel All Changes buttons are disabled or hidden. 
AND The user has the ability to change any of the relevant values, including replace the applicable file. 
AND The user has the ability to change whether or not this form appears to Club users by making the form Active or Inactive using the provided checkbox.

Wireframe:
https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=system_forms_-_boc

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+System+Forms+widget

title: As a user I want to be able to create a MN Contract for an International Amateur player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN club user is logged in with Edit International Amateur permissions
AND user is viewing International Amateur Player profiles
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Create New icon" on International Amateur profiles
custom_expected:
THEN Users are able to launch a new Minor Contract for the player via the Create New. 
AND The Minor Contract workflow is able to be completed for the new kind of International Amateur profiles, just like it was previously. This includes the information properly populating the printed MN Contract, and the contract showing up in the International Signing Bonus utility if applicable. 
AND This needs to still work for existing international amateurs. 

*Amateur conversion to professional is covered in another story*

title: As a user I want to be able to run the All Registered Players List Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC logs in with Reporting permission
custom_steps: WHEN user is in Report Widget
custom_expected:
THEN "All Registered Players" Report should be listed on reporting widget. 
AND Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
AND The category of this report should be "International". 
AND The current year should always be available for the BOC.
AND The current year should ONLY be available for anyone outside of the BOC after the Open All Registration Report system date for the current year. 
AND Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
AND The report will continue to use the existing LDAP. 
AND The report will NOT be downloadable to any format other than pdf.
AND The report will include a watermark on each page of the running user's username. 
AND Players who have been indicating as needing a # next to their names, have it. 
AND Running the report includes the designated fake players, with their DOB adjusting based on the Org of the user running the report.

Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/All+Registered+Players+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/All+Registered+Players+-+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/All+Registered+Players+-+Population%2C+Logic+and+Sort+Considerations

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/All+Registered+Players+-+Prompts

Report Security: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/All+Registered+Players+-+Audience+-+Security-+Frequency

View Story: #156213976

title: As a BOC user I want International Amateur quick searches tracked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Advanced Search
AND user navigated to the International Amateur quick Search
custom_steps: When user quick search for any Intl Ama player
custom_expected:
THEN the system needs to keep a record of every international quick search undertaken. 
AND the system will need to keep a record of the following information about each search: 
 - Username of the user conducting the search
 - Org of the user conducting the search
 - Date of the search
 - Time of the search (EST)
 - The value entered into the search bar
 - How many results were returned
AND Each time results are returned to the user is considered a new and unique search.

title: As a BOC user I want the actions taken after an International Amateur quick search tracked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama quick search permissions
AND user navigated to the International Amateur quick search
custom_steps: WHEN user quick search for any Intl Ama player
custom_expected:
THEN the system will need to keep a record of the following information about the actions taken for each search: 
 - Profiles opened as a result of the search. (Last, First and Player ID)
 - Whether the user "tagged" the player as a result of the search.
 - Whether the user created a Contract as a result of the search. 
 - Whether the user registered the player as a result of the search.

title: As a user I want to view an existing International Prospect Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in with International Prospect Report permission
AND an international ama player has existing International Prospect Report
custom_steps: WHEN user is in international player's Scouting History widget
custom_expected:
THEN the Report Date will be clickable hyperlink on the player's Scouting History widget. 
AND Clicking the hyperlink for International Prospect reports opens the report in the same window.
AND The report follows the provided wireframe and data discovery.  
AND The browser tab text says "Prospect Report(or if a code exists for this use that instead) - Last, First"
AND There is a Close button on the Report in view mode. Clicking close will return the user to their point of entry.

*Note that there are 2 different sets of fields/layouts depending on the position used for the report. If the player report is for a pitching position, use the pitching fields provided - otherwise use the position player fields*
Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=prospect_report

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Prospect+or+Signable+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a user I want to view an existing Daily Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in with Daily Report permission
AND an international ama player is included in Daily Report
custom_steps: WHEN user is in international player's Scouting History widget
custom_expected:
THEN Daily Reports should appear as a clickable hyperlink in the player's Scouting History widget for each player that is included in a Daily Report. 
AND The Report Date is a clickable hyperlink on the player's Scouting History widget. 
AND Clicking the hyperlink for Daily Reports opens the report in the same window.
AND The report follows the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The Player blocks appear in alphabetical order and are expanded by default
AND The browser tab text says "Daily Report - [report date]"
AND There is a Close button on the Report in view mode. Clicking close will return the user to their point of entry. 
AND The expand/collapse all links on the quick search will also expand/collapse all of the player blocks in addition to the form sections.  

There are actually only 2 of these in Production: https://ebis.mlb.com/scouting/dailyreport/view?rptMasterId=1007214

This is the best one and should be available in the Scouting Report widget of Player ID 798112.

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=daily_report_1

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Daily+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: As a user I want to view an existing International Workout Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC user logs with permission to view International Workout Report
custom_steps: WHEN user is in international player's Scouting History widget
custom_expected:
THEN The Report Type should be a clickable hyperlink on the player's Scouting History widget.
AND Clicking the hyperlink for International Workout reports should open the report in the same window
AND The report should follow the provided wireframe and data discovery
AND The browser tab text should say "Workout Report(or if a code exists for this use that instead) - Last, First"
AND There should be a Close button on the Report in view mode. Clicking close should return the user to their point of entry
AND There are a number of fields indicated on the form as "legacy" fields. These should not be used in new reports created after go live, but still need to display on historical reports
*Note that there are 2 different sets of fields/layouts depending on the position used for the report. If the player report is for a pitching position, use the pitching fields provided - otherwise use the position player fields*

Wireframe:
https://s8xnnx.axshare.com/#p=workout_report

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Workout+Report+-+Data+Discovery

title: International Scouting Report - Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN International Scouting Reports should only be visible to those users that have permission to view the reports
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is logged in that has any of the following permissions, AND the new intl-user LDAP(EBIS-INTL-USER-NEW) 
  - EBIS-INTL-SCOUTING-REPORT-EDITORS
  - EBIS-INTL-SCOUTING-REPORT-APPROVERS
  - EBIS-INTL-SCOUTING-REPORT-VIEWERS
custom_expected:
THEN these users should be able to view International Scouting Reports (International Workout Report, International Signable Report and International Prospect Reports)

Note:the following updates have been made to the user ids below to test this: 
  - test_ebis_user73@mlb.com should have the editors permission (Scout)
  - test_ebis_user74@mlb.com should have the approvers permission (Scout Admin)
  - test_ebis_user77@mlb.com should have the viewers permission (Scout Viewer)
  - test_ebis_user75@mlb.com should have the approvers permission (BOC Admin and Scout Admin)
  - test_ebis_user76@mlb.com should have the editors permission (BOC Admin and Scout)
  - test_ebis_user78@mlb.com should have the viewers permission (BOC Viewer and Scout Viewer)

title: As a Scout I want my Clipboard to hold only my own items
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scout Clipboards are specific to each user
custom_steps: WHEN a specific Scout user logs into the system and views their Scouting Clipboards
custom_expected: THEN ONLY those items created by their own username should appear in the widget

title: As a Scout Admin I want my Clipboard to hold only my own items and those submitted by Scouts
custom_preconds: GIVEN a scout admin user is logged in with permission to view scout admin clipboard
custom_steps: WHEN Scouting Admin user views their Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN user should see their own items, just like any scout would in their Clipboard
BUT user should not see the items in a non-Submitted state created by other Admins
AND the Admin should also see any items that have been submitted by ANY Scout or Scout Admin
